content:
I don't have personal experience of the university of virginia or charlottesville, va, but based on my research, here are some must-visit places and activities in the area:

1. monticello - the historic home of thomas jefferson, located just a few miles from uva. monticello offers tours of the house, gardens, and exhibits on jefferson's life and legacy.

2. downtown mall - a pedestrian mall located in the heart of charlottesville, featuring unique local shops, restaurants, and entertainment.

3. shenandoah national park - a breathtakingly beautiful park located just a short drive from uva, with hiking trails, waterfalls, and scenic driving routes.

4. carter mountain orchard - a family-friendly orchard with apple picking, pumpkin patches, and a stunning view of the surrounding mountains.

5. friday's after five - a free outdoor concert series held every friday during the summer and fall outside the sprint pavilion on the downtown mall.

6. historic downtown charlottesville - take a carriage ride through the town's historic district or explore the city's rich architecture on foot.

7. virginia film festival - a four-day film festival held every fall that features critically acclaimed films, documentaries, and discussions with filmmakers and actors.

these are just a few of the many exciting places and events that you can experience while attending the university of virginia in charlottesville.
